H0.text: Capillary is the type of vessel that, together with an arteriole, gives a metarteriole its structural characteristics of both an arteriole and a capillary.

H1.text: Tendon is the structure whose structural characteristics a metarteriole shares along with those of an arteriole.

H2.text: Electron is the structural characteristic that a metarteriole shares with an arteriole.

H3.text: Layer is a structural characteristic shared by both a metarteriole and an arteriole.

A4.text: Instead of a continuous tunica media, they have individual smooth muscle cells placed a short distance apart, each forming a precapillary sphincter that encircles the entrance to that capillary bed.

A5.text: A metarteriole is a short microvessel in the microcirculation that links arterioles and capillaries.
